alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Lewis; Oswego (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 9:18AM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...Heavy Rain and Gusty Winds across the Eastern Lake Ontario This Morning... At 915 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Adams to near Cicero. Movement was east at 40 mph. This line of storms could produce wind gusts to 40 mph along with frequent cloud to ground lightning. Besides this line of thunderstorms, the entire Eastern Lake Ontario region will continue to receive moderately heavy rain into the late morning. Some areas could receive upwards of an inch to an inch and a half of rain by lunchtime. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Watertown, Oswego, Fulton, Fort Drum, Sandy Island Beach State Park, Stony Point, Carthage, Lowville, Pulaski, West Carthage, Clayton, Central Square, Adams, Dexter, Redfield, Glen Park, Herrings, Kring Point State Park, Highmarket and Mexico Point State Park. This includes Interstate 81 between exits 32 and 52. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
